result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. John J Stessl

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt:
[ma] Case called at 8:56 AM 
Defendant John J Stessl in court.  Attorney Jeffrey Jacob De La Rosa in court for John J Stessl.  Attorney Michael Witt in court for State of Wisconsin. 

Atty De La Rosa confirms appointment of Case 22CF345.

Preliminary Hearing occurs in Case 22CF345: 
Detective Dale Punzel -sworn & testifies
--direct examination by ADA Witt
--the Court takes judicial notice of bond in 21CF474
--cross examination by Attorney De La Rosa 
--examination by the Court 

Atty De La Rosa moves to dismiss. 

The Court finds probable cause that Mr. Stessl committed a felony. The Court binds him over for Trial.

recess: 9:15am  

NEXT:  Arraignment on 12/1/22 at 9:30am

Pre-trial conference on September 21, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Preliminary hearing on October 11, 2022 at 08:30 am.

[MK] cases #21CF474. #21CT209. #22CF345 called at 9:26am 
Defendant John J Stessl in court with Attorney Jeffrey De La Rosa. DA Monica Hall appears for the State of Wisconsin.
Case #22CF345 is scheduled for Preliminary Hearing today, and the State's officer-witness is present.  However Attorney De La Rosa indicates he had not been appointed on this case, and the Defense is not prepared to proceed today.  Attorney De La Rosa requests the scheduling of a pretrial conference and that the prelim be rescheduled. 
recess 9:55am 

NEXT:  (1) Pretrial Conference on September 21st at 10:00am,  (2) Status Conference in #21CF474 and #21CT209, and Preliminary Hearing in #22CF345--all on October 11th at 8:30am
Preliminary hearing on September 1, 2022 at 09:00 am.

-- no possession or consumption of controlled substances without a valid prescription;  to take prescription medications only as prescribed
--no possession of any drug paraphernalia to include needles and syringes

[ae] cases 21CF83, 21CF474, 21CT209 called 1:09 PM Defendant John J Stessl in court.  Attorney Jeffrey Jacob De La Rosa in court for John J Stessl. ADA Parson in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Status Conference held in cases 21CF474 and 21CT209 and the parties would like to proceed to plea/sentencing in case 21CF83

Parties acknowledge that they have received and reviewed the Amended Information- adding count #2 and removing the repeater enhancer from count #1
Parties are in agreement of removing the domestic abuse repeater enhancer, the court allows the removal of the enhancer

Maximum penalties are recited; Constitutional rights are reviewed; plea of "no contest" entered on Count #1 and #2; factual basis stipulated; victim rights compliance is verified.  The Court accepts the plea, finds the Defendant guilty, and orders Judgment of Conviction entered.

Sentencing recommendations/ arguments given by Counsel 

On Counts #1 and #2, the Court withholds sentence and places the Defendant on Probation for 2 years, with conditions:

--continued AODA counseling and therapy 
--random drug and/or alcohol screening
--mental health assessment and follow through with treatment
--to undergo any other assessment, treatment, or counseling per Agent
--contact with Victim 1 as authorized by Victim 1 and agent
--no acts or threats of violence
--payment of costs, fees, surcharges

Days credit for time already served:  3 days

Defendant is to report to Probation by 3 pm today

As to cases 21CF474 and 21CT209: Parties are in the process of working out an agreement and would like a status scheduled. Atty De La Rosa requests that defendant new case be called and IA be conducted 
The Court calls 22CF345

The Defendant verifies that the address and date of birth listed on the Criminal Complaint are correct. 
Service of Complaint admitted, reading waived, the charges and maximum penalties are recited
Preliminary Hearing time limits are waived by both parties.


The Court requires $2500  Signature Bond, with conditions:
-- no possession or consumption of controlled substances without a valid prescription;  to take prescription medications only as prescribed
--no possession of any drug paraphernalia to include needles and syringes 

NEXT: STC 9/1/22 at 9 am [Prelim for 22CF345}
recess 1:38 pm
Defendant has pending cases assigned to Branch 1
